positive.review:
[h2] üò∏ Fishers Fishing Journey Review üé£ [/h2]

Fishers Fishing Journey is an incredibly addictive and adorable idle game! Your job as Fisher is to collect fish of different types, grades, and even special quest items to help her friends. While fishing, you can also discover cute decorations.

Let‚Äôs talk fish! There are plenty of them to catch, and each of the five fishing areas has its own unique species. The game makes it easy to keep track of everything with a well organized fishpedia sorted by category and location. Some fish require specific bait or weather conditions, and the weather system itself is really fun, each map has its own patterns that affect what you can catch. While exploring new areas, Fisher will meet new friends. Each zone has two NPCs you can help, and completing their quests rewards you with useful fishing buffs or adorable RV decorations.

Speaking of the RV‚Ä¶ This is Kiki‚Äôs domain! She‚Äôs a tiny mouse (I think?) who runs the shop where you‚Äôll buy bait, unlock new areas, upgrade bag space, purchase chums, and collect decorations for Fisher and your fish tanks.

Ah yes, the fish tanks! I absolutely love games with fish tanks. Your main magic tank is the most important one, as it generates money depending on the fish you place inside. Adding multiple of the same type boosts earnings, but mixing different fish can also be beneficial, it‚Äôs entirely up to your strategy. There are also extra decorative tanks to store and display fish however you like. I used one just to keep rainbow shiny fish for an achievement, and it was perfect.

A quick note on a small glitch: I ran into a visual bug when leveling up Kiki‚Äôs shop. Sometimes the required fishpedia completion percentage doesn‚Äôt appear in her dialogue bubble, you only see the coin requirement. If the shop isn‚Äôt leveling up even after you‚Äôve earned the right amount of coins, you probably just need to increase your fishpedia percentage. It‚Äôs harmless, just a bit confusing at first.

Fishers Fishing Journey is a delightful and relaxing idle game. Early on, bag space requires some attention so Fisher doesn‚Äôt stop to take ‚Äútea breaks,‚Äù but upgrades fix that over time. The achievements are straightforward and very doable, though completing the fishpedia can take a while. I‚Äôm 160 hours in and still hunting down a few rare fish, even with max rod upgrades, luck and patience are key.

Enjoy your time, Fishers!!üêü

[quote]Tip: If you want to find more reviews like this, check out our curator page [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41527689/]Moon's Tea House[/url][/quote]

It's a game about a cat in some post-apocalyptic world fishing for random and sometimes hideously mutated fish species at some random places. And doing it very slowly and painfully.
Perfect game to sit down, relax and think about what you're doing with your life.

This game is very relaxing and wholesome as the story goes on :)

Very soothing ambience and music as well as stunning soft visuals and a quirky shopkeeper.
Love this addicting little passive (or active) game!! can't wait for more!!
My new favorite idle game for sure! I work from home and this is the perfect little work buddy

I've tried a lot of the idle games since I like having something in the background while I work, and this is one of my absolute favorites! It's cute, not complicated, and has nice music. The little mini events (character pop-ups, catching a handful of fish at once) give a nice little break when they pop up and don't feel stressful. Some of the "idle" games I played you had to be very present for or run the risk of missing something you would need to unlock the new area. I love this little game, I'm so glad I picked this one up!

Total chill vibes. Perfect background noise for studying/working. Since it's an idle game, I guess it is what it is, but some mini-games would be nice to break the monotony. I know the Miracle Fish is hit or miss for some people, but I dig the endgame grind, so I'm a fan.

Good idle game. Have it on in the background while I work and it isn't too distracting like other idle games I've tried. Nice for a good break in between tasks. A bit grindy but it is just idle progress.

It's nice to put in the background for the music. But this is not an idle game for the first 20 hours or so, when you have to do everything manually to get progress. So I wouldn't actively recommend it to someone else, because this game is a prison for people who are here for the actual content. Get Bongo Cat, for example, to earn something when you're doing your own thing, like playing other games, doom-scrolling, or working, not like this one where you're distracting yourself from doing them
The game is really cool and relaxing. You can sit, get hooked, and have fun)
Just one of those idle games i keep coming back to and wanting to tick off the 100% completion

Game is very cute and I love it a lot! There's a few small things that could be added to make it more interactive, like petting the visiting animals or interacting with things in the background, the chum recharge could also be a bit faster and it absolutely is an afk game once you get auto sell and auto buy, as it'll take a long while to get later upgrades. Personally hoping for modding support at some point but I'm excited to see what future updates add!

An extremely cute and relaxing idle game. My 2 1/2 year old son loves to watch it (especially the fish tank) and the soundtrack calms him down. I would recommend this to anyone that's looking for something cozy.

This game is a real gem, I enjoyed it so much, the fact that i can make this my background or have it fade into my desktop was so awesome. I loved the game play and getting the upgrades. My daughter enjoyed buying the cosmetics and dressing up our cat. Overall great idle game, i would recommend this to anyone. Getting all the achievements was also fun,
A cute and super chill game
chillax game, my family love seeing the cat fish
Ïß±Íµ¨ÎäîÎ™ªÎßêÎ†§ÎÇúÏû•ÌåêÏùòÏ∂îÏ≤úÌîΩ
Cat does good work. Go cat.
Very good idle fishing game
Nice desktop idler.
adorable idle game
Great little game <3
500+ hours of fishing...
Recommended
Fish. Yes.

I love this game. It‚Äôs perfect to have in the background while I‚Äôm studying, and I really enjoy listening to its music. It can get a bit frustrating when I‚Äôm trying to catch the last few fish for 100% completion, but honestly, that just means I get to play and enjoy it even longer.

It's adorable I cannot lie. Getting to meet all of the cute critters and hear their stories is also fun. I'm currently just waiting for the 100,000,000 coin achievement and I'll have caught them all!
Cute random creature collector / idler thing. Terrible translation makes characters unintentionally creepy which is a bonus in my book.
A very calm idle game with soothing music that comes with every map.

This game is very relaxing and wholesome as the story goes on :)

Very soothing ambience and music as well as stunning soft visuals and a quirky shopkeeper.
Love this addicting little passive (or active) game!! can't wait for more!!

I've tried a lot of the idle games since I like having something in the background while I work, and this is one of my absolute favorites! It's cute, not complicated, and has nice music. The little mini events (character pop-ups, catching a handful of fish at once) give a nice little break when they pop up and don't feel stressful. Some of the "idle" games I played you had to be very present for or run the risk of missing something you would need to unlock the new area. I love this little game, I'm so glad I picked this one up!

It's nice to put in the background for the music. But this is not an idle game for the first 20 hours or so, when you have to do everything manually to get progress. So I wouldn't actively recommend it to someone else, because this game is a prison for people who are here for the actual content. Get Bongo Cat, for example, to earn something when you're doing your own thing, like playing other games, doom-scrolling, or working, not like this one where you're distracting yourself from doing them
The game is really cool and relaxing. You can sit, get hooked, and have fun)
Just one of those idle games i keep coming back to and wanting to tick off the 100% completion

Game is very cute and I love it a lot! There's a few small things that could be added to make it more interactive, like petting the visiting animals or interacting with things in the background, the chum recharge could also be a bit faster and it absolutely is an afk game once you get auto sell and auto buy, as it'll take a long while to get later upgrades. Personally hoping for modding support at some point but I'm excited to see what future updates add!

An extremely cute and relaxing idle game. My 2 1/2 year old son loves to watch it (especially the fish tank) and the soundtrack calms him down. I would recommend this to anyone that's looking for something cozy.

This game is a real gem, I enjoyed it so much, the fact that i can make this my background or have it fade into my desktop was so awesome. I loved the game play and getting the upgrades. My daughter enjoyed buying the cosmetics and dressing up our cat. Overall great idle game, i would recommend this to anyone. Getting all the achievements was also fun,

The audio of this game reminds me of the music my parents used to put me to bed with; needless to say, it's calming, nostalgic, and comforting. The game itself is super cute and relaxing to play, with progression that isn't too easy, but isn't too hard either.
If you're into idle games and enjoy the calming vibes of fishing, this game is definitely worth checking out. It's simple, fun, and surprisingly addictive.
really chill afk game. will be better if got option to change soundtrack
My darling put me to sleep playing this game so I bought it. 10 out of 10 would recommend for relaxation

It's the best time waster. If I'm too busy to play a game or I'm working on my art stuff, it's nice to look over and see this little dude fishing away. I love the options on how he shows up on desktop. I'm not a fan of the other maps so far but the first map is the best and my favorite. It is exciting to work up to get a new map though. So, there is progression in the game.

I'm constantly looking for games to fill the in-between spaces when I need a break or an opportunity to unwind. As an avid fan of both fishing games and idling games, Fischer's Fishing Journey provides a blend of both and creates a beautiful and relaxing atmosphere to just kick back, fish and hang out with your animal friends.

A great companion for studying, or for company on a quiet evening, Fischer will stay with you through night and day to fish, drink a soda, and enjoy the stillness of the world.

This game also has a lot to unlock, a custom fish tank that provides an additional passive income and allows you to keep your favorite catches, and lots of opportunities to keep playing for additional awards, customization, and achievements.
Relaxing low energy cozy game to unwind and chill. 6/10.
It's cute, and the funny fish names you see sometimes are very amusing.
An adorable cat, relaxing ambient sounds, and lovely background music... What more could you want?
Slow paced and designed to be taken at it's own speed, this is a cozy and pleasant experience.

[h2]OMG Yeah![/h2]

There's a cat on my desktop, fishing... A CAT... and FISHING!!! On my DESKTOP!
Damn, of course I recommend this game!

[u]Rating:[/u] 10 out of 10 paws
After 600 hours, I have achieved everything. Good game for sleeping 10/10
81+ hours just to leave computer before snoozing. It needs more update though

Enjoyed the game a lot as a chill game to play while I was going through a bad time, would like for the auto sell addon to include more complex logic like having the ability to only keep if a fish is shiny and rainbow so I could continue trying to improve my money making fish tank but with all achievements complete I'm happy.

Perfect idle game. Interactive enough to keep you coming back to check on it but enough freedom with upgrades to be able to afk freely and still progress, which is exactly what I look for in an idler. I recommend it if you like this genre!
A cute and super chill game
chillax game, my family love seeing the cat fish
I finished it quicker than I thought. Caught everything and fully upgraded my gear in 69 hours (nice).
omg this game is so cute!!! havent had this much fun since webfishing

Thanks for the hours, Fischer
I like this game a normal amount
not really happy at all low key want to stop playing FIVE chum 18k??????????????? make that make sense....
love it
500+ hours of fishing...
cute fishe i like to fish yay ^_^
nice
so so so cute !! ‚ô°
Recommended

I have played this a normal amount....

Meow Meow Meow Meow

It's adorable I cannot lie. Getting to meet all of the cute critters and hear their stories is also fun. I'm currently just waiting for the 100,000,000 coin achievement and I'll have caught them all!
Cute random creature collector / idler thing. Terrible translation makes characters unintentionally creepy which is a bonus in my book.
A very calm idle game with soothing music that comes with every map.

This game is very relaxing and wholesome as the story goes on :)

Very soothing ambience and music as well as stunning soft visuals and a quirky shopkeeper.
Love this addicting little passive (or active) game!! can't wait for more!!

I've tried a lot of the idle games since I like having something in the background while I work, and this is one of my absolute favorites! It's cute, not complicated, and has nice music. The little mini events (character pop-ups, catching a handful of fish at once) give a nice little break when they pop up and don't feel stressful. Some of the "idle" games I played you had to be very present for or run the risk of missing something you would need to unlock the new area. I love this little game, I'm so glad I picked this one up!

Total chill vibes. Perfect background noise for studying/working. Since it's an idle game, I guess it is what it is, but some mini-games would be nice to break the monotony. I know the Miracle Fish is hit or miss for some people, but I dig the endgame grind, so I'm a fan.

Good idle game. Have it on in the background while I work and it isn't too distracting like other idle games I've tried. Nice for a good break in between tasks. A bit grindy but it is just idle progress.

It's nice to put in the background for the music. But this is not an idle game for the first 20 hours or so, when you have to do everything manually to get progress. So I wouldn't actively recommend it to someone else, because this game is a prison for people who are here for the actual content. Get Bongo Cat, for example, to earn something when you're doing your own thing, like playing other games, doom-scrolling, or working, not like this one where you're distracting yourself from doing them
The game is really cool and relaxing. You can sit, get hooked, and have fun)
Just one of those idle games i keep coming back to and wanting to tick off the 100% completion

Game is very cute and I love it a lot! There's a few small things that could be added to make it more interactive, like petting the visiting animals or interacting with things in the background, the chum recharge could also be a bit faster and it absolutely is an afk game once you get auto sell and auto buy, as it'll take a long while to get later upgrades. Personally hoping for modding support at some point but I'm excited to see what future updates add!

An extremely cute and relaxing idle game. My 2 1/2 year old son loves to watch it (especially the fish tank) and the soundtrack calms him down. I would recommend this to anyone that's looking for something cozy.

negative.review: Initially I really enjoyed this game, but the grind at the end was rough. However, the new update has really tanked the game imo from the view of a completionist. Getting the rainbow star miracle fish has been a NIGHTMARE for me. I can no longer recommend the game. Ive spent 200 hours alone trying to get them and im still missing 4. I play active, I get nothing. I play passive, I get nothing. What is this grindy bs????? 4/10

Initially I really enjoyed this game, but the grind at the end was rough. However, the new update has really tanked the game imo from the view of a completionist. Getting the rainbow star miracle fish has been a NIGHTMARE for me. I can no longer recommend the game. Ive spent 200 hours alone trying to get them and im still missing 4. I play active, I get nothing. I play passive, I get nothing. What is this grindy bs????? 4/10

I do love this game its hard for me to hate a idle game, but coming from a completionist standpoint, and a active player standpoint, this game is a nightmare.

This is a idle game, but you earn no idle income when the game is closed. You are forced to leave the game running to earn income. You cant have an active playstyle either because this game has no option that supports an active playstyle the only benefit you get from playing actively is maybe doing an NPC quest to give you 2 chum, which feels useless because you are going to catch 3 maybe 4 fish at most with it when it sometimes takes catching like 20 fish to even finish an NPC quest, then they take forever to leave and come back, and sometimes they come back and they don't even have a quest for you making you wait even longer.

It feels like to make up for it you could add more shop features like "click screen to make fish appear faster" or "change weather status in certain location for one day" or "set time to day or night" just some kind of quality of life change for the late game players to make it easier but also making them work for it by buying it in the shop, because if you want to 100% this game you are going to be spending 100s of hours on this game, but this game doesn't feel like it has 100s of hours of content to make up for the grind.

Initially I really enjoyed this game, but the grind at the end was rough. However, the new update has really tanked the game imo from the view of a completionist. Getting the rainbow star miracle fish has been a NIGHTMARE for me. I can no longer recommend the game. Ive spent 200 hours alone trying to get them and im still missing 4. I play active, I get nothing. I play passive, I get nothing. What is this grindy bs????? 4/10

I do love this game its hard for me to hate a idle game, but coming from a completionist standpoint, and a active player standpoint, this game is a nightmare.

This is a idle game, but you earn no idle income when the game is closed. You are forced to leave the game running to earn income. You cant have an active playstyle either because this game has no option that supports an active playstyle the only benefit you get from playing actively is maybe doing an NPC quest to give you 2 chum, which feels useless because you are going to catch 3 maybe 4 fish at most with it when it sometimes takes catching like 20 fish to even finish an NPC quest, then they take forever to leave and come back, and sometimes they come back and they don't even have a quest for you making you wait even longer.

It feels like to make up for it you could add more shop features like "click screen to make fish appear faster" or "change weather status in certain location for one day" or "set time to day or night" just some kind of quality of life change for the late game players to make it easier but also making them work for it by buying it in the shop, because if you want to 100% this game you are going to be spending 100s of hours on this game, but this game doesn't feel like it has 100s of hours of content to make up for the grind.

Initially I really enjoyed this game, but the grind at the end was rough. However, the new update has really tanked the game imo from the view of a completionist. Getting the rainbow star miracle fish has been a NIGHTMARE for me. I can no longer recommend the game. Ive spent 200 hours alone trying to get them and im still missing 4. I play active, I get nothing. I play passive, I get nothing. What is this grindy bs????? 4/10
